column5: We've had some really stable weather lately... a high pressure system that settled in and gave us clear skies and cold temps.  The fishing has suffered from it this week so today we decided to switch it up and try a lake we hadn't been on in more then a month.  Minnitaki lake is part of the Abram, Pelican and Lac Seul system.  It's a massive lake it its own right that holds walleye, pike and lake trout.  The action was still on the slow side, but I had a couple of nice ones come up today.  This guy hit my jig on the way down.  I watched it chase on the flasher then my line stopped.  Hook set, game on.... this isn't a walleye I'm thinking.      Pretty fun on the walleye gear.  We were jigging on a hump and I was on the shallowest part at 19'.  I had on a jigging rap tipped with a minnow.  I had just caught a nice eater and dropped back down.  jig-jig-jig... big red band on the flasher... raise it up... follow.. hold still.... bang, she hits it.  Slammed the hook set and knew right away it wasn't a small one.  Sure was glad to see this girls big head pop up the hole    Fished a bit more with nothing else and packed it in when the sun dipped below the trees.  Another good day in NW Ontario.
WTG.  Some real monsters through the ice.  Looks like you had some decent weather too.  Nice and sunny, no falling snow.  Looks like you had a great day.
Nice Ben...How big was the girl?
Very nicely done Ben.  Thanks for the report and great pics     Congrats on a good days  You've gotta love it when the Big ones come out to play and just slam the baits!!
26"  Clean as a whistle and nice and dark.
*sigh* I wish I lived up there....   Thanks for sharing -- those are some beauties!!!
GREAT report love those fish they look VERY healthy...  that pike is a pure northern ..... i know just by looking at it ....  and that walleye!   what a NUGGET!  again. congrats!
Walleye with white eyes ...  say that 10 times in a row  :P   Nice fish for sure right there....
Wow those are 2 beautiful and monstrous specimens, good job!
Thats serious fishing right there. Good work!
WTG Ben!  Cor blimey me ole mucka, that walleye is the dogs bollox!   BTW....how'd it go the other day with the Vex tutorial?
Nice ones 4sure, good on ya...
Awesome! Good looking fish. 2nd pic of the pike is cool.
Nice fish indeed! Thats a beauty pike you've got there Ben!
wow great fish for sure congrats!!!!!  cheers!
beauty catch! that pickerels gotta be a keeper; great photos too!
She went right back down the hole, after a couple of pictures.  I release all walleye over 18".  Anything bigger, I don't consider good table fare.  Also, a walleye over 18" is a prime spawner.
I agree with you there Ben nice to see others concerned with the spawners  I prefer in the 2-4 pound range for the table
Hey Ben that pike must have been a fun catch. Love the fight they give. Nice pickerel too. Well done.
You got me drooling Ben... that gator is massive and the big girl, golden dark    congratulations Kudos for releasing her Thanks for sharing Jacques
Those are some nice size fish for sure!!!.... congrats
Stellar as usual Ben.
I only dream of pike that big.  You make it look easy Ben
I only dream of pike that big.  You make it look easy Ben
Great looking gators there Ben  Well done
